original_solution_mapping.L1: He has 3 apples and 4 bananas, so he has 3 + 4 = <<3+4=7>>7 pieces of fruit.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He needs to buy 12 fruit - 7 fruit = <<12-7=5>>5 oranges.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1517.
    Returns: the number of oranges Mark needs to pick out.
    """
    # L1
    apples = 3 # 3 apples
    bananas = 4 # 4 bananas
    current_fruit = apples + bananas

    # L2
    total_desired_fruit = 12 # 12 pieces of fruit
    oranges_needed = total_desired_fruit - current_fruit

    # FA
    answer = oranges_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He has {apples} apples and {bananas} bananas, so he has {apples} + {bananas} = <<{apples}+{bananas}={current_fruit}>>{current_fruit} pieces of fruit.
He needs to buy {total_desired_fruit} fruit - {current_fruit} fruit = <<{total_desired_fruit}-{current_fruit}={oranges_needed}>>{oranges_needed} oranges.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He needs to buy 12 fruit - 7 fruit = <<12-7=19>>19 oranges.
